title: Trek to a hidden gem above Neer Waterfall
review: Being popularized as AQUAONEWORLD and Neer SHIVA CAFE, it's a must visit for anyone be it a traveller or someone looking to come back to nature and oneself.

title: Incredible and restorative place
review: Two incredible falls, with possibility of feeding on the spot. A quiet climb but need for resistance, clean and crystal clear water.

title: nice place to visit
review: if you love water then do visit here once. great musty with family, suggest you to visit in summer as it's very cold these day.

title: Must place to visit..Hidden trekking
review: Firstly when we heard about this we were it will b a water fall ,we just have to reach there and see.But surprisingly we need to trek for almost 2 hrs to see the actual water fall.While on the trek there are many stalls from which u can have water,tea,coffee,cold drinks,maggi,egg etc.

title: must visit
review: what a hidden gem in rishikesh. 30 rs per person charge and a bit of a climb to get to this paradise.

title: Neer Garh Waterfall
review: My trip was very nice. I enjoyed a lot. The scenic beauty was very beautiful. Adorable scenery. One should definately visit this place.

title: good walk
review: Worth taking a good walk if you are the walking type. The rewarding view when you reach the falls is calming.

title: Lovely waterfall with beautiful birds!
review: Visited Feb 7, 2019. Lovely falls, nice ride to view countryside.  Amit was a great driver (recommended from hotel yog vashishth).  Ate breakfast at a local place "Waterfall Restaurant".  best omelette believe it or not!  delicious food (nope, didn't get sick!).  looked scary, but the people were so nice and breakfast was fresh eggs and toast and excellent milk tea.  recommend falls and breakfast !!

title: Superb waterfall trek with wonderful views
review: We stayed at Aloha resorts and booked this nature walk through them only. Anuj , our guide helped us with his continuous support and knowledge about the area. He provided us sticks and his co-guide Vishal helped us climb the difficult terrain.They carried foldable chairs and refreshments for us. On reaching there they both made us comfortable in chairs with our feet in water near the waterfall. We enjoyed snacks and hot tea with beautiful view of waterfall and birds chirping around. We spent an hour there and returned.

title: Worth a look
review: Clean water, swimable if you can brave the cold

title: Good but not that great
review: This spot is not very far from Laxman jhoola . You need to pay Rs 30 per head for entry for Indians and Rs 50 for foreigners . Waterfall is a short trek away from the parking spot . In simmering summers ,it's a good option to spend time in cold water without having to worry about the current as its a good pool where people can enjoy .

title: Neer Garh Waterfall
review: Beautiful scenery, beautiful sounds of water fall and only nature around. I and my wife thoroughly enjoyed each moment. After a swim..you will feel energized.I loved this hidden gem in Rishikesh.Please respect the nature.

title: Escape and take a deep breath
review: This is a nice spot not near Rishikesh.

title: Wow!
review: I am so happy I hiked down from the mountain, to see this beautiful place.  The water is so pristine and felt good on my tired feet.  It is a must see!!

title: Must visit Lake when in Rishikesh
review: Short hike up the hill to reach the natural water pond coming from the beautiful waterfalls.

title: Arrive Early For A Good And Quick Hike
review: I would suggest starting this hike up along the Neer Garh/Neer Gaddu Waterfalls on the earlier side to avoid the crowds. Or, maybe it was crowded by the end of our hike because it was during the Diwali holiday season. Either way, having the rocky but still fairly well-maintained trails to yourself is better. Maybe carry a towel and wear a bathing suit or quick-dry clothes as there a couple of places to jump into cooling ponds situated under the various waterfalls. There are tiny kiosks where you can buy drinks and snacks along the trail and, at the top of the main trail, there are benches under tarps to rest on. If you choose to continue up above this point (which is only about a 15 minutes hike up), you will be rewarded with the discovery of a couple of camping areas, a mountaintop Hindu temple, and great vistas over the valley. There is no need for a guide, there are no bathrooms (except for the woods!) and admission fees vary for Indian vs. tourist hikers.

title: Awsome view
review: We had ...visit Neergarh waterfall in October month...the waterfall is very big and the view of this falls is awesome. if you are planing a leisurely trip with your family and friends so it will good option for you.

title: Waterfall
review: Considered to be one of the most famous waterfalls, we found this one to be nearby from where we were staying.

title: Serene place with an amazing trek.
review: Its a very small trek to the waterfall, and a huge one after that which takes you through the jungle. Beware of monkeys here. Try the Maggi and coffee around here. I suggest to keep a time of around 1 hour in this place to optimize your itinerary.

title: Closed due to bad weather
review: It was closed due to bad weather and should open back again in the last week of august. The hike is quite a lot so you must be physically in top shape and must have your own bottle of water. Once you reach there it's a sight to behold. A dip in the pool under the falls takes all the fatigue away.

title: Adventure Trip to Rishikesh
review: I have been to rishikesh many times for river rafting and river side camping this time while i was roaming around near laxman jhula a traveller from Australia asked me about this waterfall about which i was also not aware of so i enquired with local people i came to know about this beautiful hidden gem in Rishikesh.

title: An exciting underwater-molestation experience
review: The place is full of creeps, would not recommend women, children and families to go there. Although the waterfall is beautiful, but there is little left of the aesthetics when you see naked creeps from Haryana, Punjab claiming the place like their own.

title: Beautiful & Natural Waterfall
review: We 3 friends just made a trip of Rishikesh in June 2018 and just visited at Neer Garh Waterfall, Rishikesh. It was such an amazing experience at Neer Garh. I must say It's Awesome waterfall like beautiful scenery.

title: Dreamy day
review: Beautiful piece of nature away from the buzz of Risikesh. The second waterfall was our favourite, with the clearest water and an incredibly kind man who runs the little shop and cafe. He made us feel incredibly comfortable and we spent a wonderful morning swimming, sitting in the sun and drinking masala chai with India’s magic masala crisps!

title: A good place to visit
review: A visit to these waterfalls is a must but its recommended to visit early morning when it will be less crowded. During the day time there is too much of tourist rush which reduces the serenity of the place.

title: Nice Waterfall.
review: Located at 20-25 minutes drive from Laxmanjhula, Neer Garh Waterfall or Neer Gaddu is natural waterfall with 3 catchments i.e. 3 waterfalls at 3 different levels. Bridge is also there to cross the catchments. One should visit early to avoid the crowd. Entry fee is INR 30 for Indian citizen which needs to be paid at the prescribed entry counter.

title: Dipping in three amazing pools
review: The path is well mended.

title: Neer Waterfall
review: Neer waterfall is a very beautiful place near Rishikesh ... If you do not have any problem in climbing the height then you must go here.

title: One with the nature
review: Great place to go

title: Trekking is surely fun @ Neer Garh!!
review: Its a must place if you visit Rishikesh as its accessible (even if you have kids to accompany) and its each and every point is scenic. You can start early to scale this place and the water is so crystal clear & refreshing. To add to the fun you can grab a bowl of maggi too..so take out your sneakers & start rocking..HAPPY TREKKING...

title: Chilling winters but awesome experience
review: Being at neergarh waterfall,rishikhesh was an exhilarating experience.If you wish to spend some quality time with your family and friends amidst nature-rich environment, you can definitely plan a waterfall trekking in Rishikesh.The trekking to Neergarh waterfall starts 7-8 kms away from Laxman Jhula on the Badrinath Highway.One will witness water cascading thousands of feet from the mountain top if visits this waterfall just after monsoon season.Though I visited this waterfall in the month of december and believe me it was hell cold.

title: Trek with waterfall
review: The trekking is good, but it is very slippery after it rains. The waterfall is good, but Patna Waterfall is better in every terms.

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful Waterfall, which is accessible to all. Calm and peaceful environment. Just don't go there during weekend's or holidays...

title: Trek and mountain climbing at one place
review: Guys let me tell you if you are visting this place just don’t stop for small waterfalls below u have to trek to the top and then u will witness the actual fun not only this. On the top from where the water is flowing is something really beautiful people who want to try mountain climbing and have never did anything as such kindly go and climb to the top because their you will see the clear water i have shared the pictures you can just check it out

title: It is a must see in Rishi
review: During hot summer days, you might find Neer Garh Waterfall as a remedy.  Beautiful nature and great swimming.

title: Everything but water!
review: If you don't mind milling crowds, screaming kids, slippery slopes and men and women occupying the small pools that lead to the actual waterfall, [we saw a man in some yogic pose inside the water with his eyes shut occupying a large part of the pool] and jostling you when you try to climb up or down,then this is the place for you.

title: Natural waterfall, good hike
review: It is a nice natural waterfall, try to go higher as the lower levels are crowded. It will be a good hike, lesser tourists and cleaner water.

title: Easy walk, clean and cool water
review: If you want to enjoy a dip in peace then set off early, we arrived at about 9.30 and spent an hour in the water before it started to get busy with groups of indian boys drinking alcohol. So if you want a peaceful swim then go early, also better to walk at this time in the heat.we walked along the highway from laxman jhula and took about 1hr to reach. It costs 100inr for tourists.

title: Refreshing and close in
review: We took transport to the temple at the top of the mountain to see sunrise and make an offering. Then hiked down for a couple of hours, arriving at the waterfall and pools. Swam in the pool and cooled off before heading down the path to the road.

title: A calm serene place with crystal clear water.
review: This fall has two levels, the lower level and the upper level.

title: Go there before it is run down by hooliganism
review: A wonderful hike just out of Rishikesh. The level 1 is nice and well spread, level 2 is even better. Well marked trail and a short hike. My 8 year son could also do it without any difficulty.  Highly recommended.

title: Walking Up Along a Waterfall
review: Also known as Need Jharna, is about 2km from Lakshman Jhula.

title: Serene place
review: I did this trek in dec. It is a half hour hike,, from the starting place,, Had to take short breaks as it is at a certain high,, there are tea and maggi points in between,, the color of the water at the waterfall is so beautiful

title: Coziness at its hieght
review: Neer Garh waterfalls consists of 3 waterfalls simuntaneously, you have to buy a ticket of just Rs. 30 person whose counter is on the main highway only. Then ride on for 1.5 kms and you reach the place and then comes the love for trekkers, you have to trek a bit you will find 2 big waterfall which is the 1st and 3rd one and 2nd is a smaller one, if you like the biggest of the fall then you have to climb the most but if you want to enjoy the bath, then stop at 1st waterfall and enjoy that fall.

title: A nice and beautiful trekking spot
review: This is a beautiful waterfall in the Rishikesh. What makes it beautiful and worth going is: there are hardly any waterfalls in Rishikesh that you can access with 10-15 min of hiking.

title: nice trek and beautiful waterfall
review: trekking and a little hiking to the water fall was a nice experience, kids enjoyed a lot in water there..... nice place, ideal for family with kids to relax.....

title: Natural
review: An awesome place to be there u have to do some trekking to reach there nice place to hangout in Summer

title: Trek to Stupendous Waterfall
review: Neer Gaddu or Neer Garh Waterfall is a famous and stupendous waterfall situated just 9 km away from the main city of Rishikesh in Uttarakhand. The captivating eternal beauty of the waterfall, "Neer Gaddu Waterfall" is a perfect trekking getaway that will definitely leave you awestruck. The water flowing from the natural petrous scaur entices the people to take a cool and refreshing dip in the narrow stream.

title: must visit to enjoy this little water fall near to Laxman jhula (around 2 to 3 km)
review: it is not that much explored place and can be enjoyed and safer place to take bath under water fall. also you can enjoy hot tea  / hot maggi served by little stall owners at there.

title: Little treasure
review: This is a steep hike through picturesque landscape to and past the waterfall. Depending on how far you wish to walk, the path leads on to a small cluster of farm houses and into the Himalayas. This is as far as I went. You have to pay to access the path from this side, 30 rupees for Indian nationals and 50 for foreigners. You can then drive up as far as the bottom of the waterfall, however, I recommend leaving the car and walking as the path does not follow the road, but rather climbs along side the stream. Take your swimwear if you fancy a paddle.

title: Enjoy
review: Great place for eating Maggie on hill top..go and enjoy in the moth of April .....it's a good place .

title: good water fall
review: it is not very big waterfall but if you are in rishikesh you can visit here. it is near laxman jhula and it was much crowded.

title: Mesmerizing waterfall
review: This waterfall located at a distance of two Kilometres from the Lakshman Jhula is a place of rejuvenation and relaxing. One needs to trek to visit it. It is an easy trek. The natural  beauty of the place and surroundings is mesmerizing. Feel the peace and calmness.

title: Worth the hike
review: Lovely cascading pools of water. A pretty easy hike to the top and a fun place to cool off on a hot day.

title: Beautiful waterfall - worth the trek
review: Beautiful scenery, a lovely hike and a fantastic waterfall at the end of it. My only regret is not taking any swim shorts to have a dip in the water. We walked from Rishikesh and it took around 1 1/2 hours - if oyu don't fancy this you could take a taxi / rickshaw and they will wait for you.

title: Great for a swim
review: Awesome waterfall with some great naturally formed pools. Do carry your towel and changing clothes. There are 2 pools on different levels and changes rooms as well.

title: Mesmerizing
review: The Scenery was mesmerizing and beautiful. The trek was also lovely. It is a must-see because of its beauty and the breath of fresh air feeling is so good. This place is for rejuvenation and relaxation. So, please do come to this place and it is worth it. The waterfall is located at the distance of 2 km from the Lakshman Jhula.

title: More Worth if done with hike from Tapovan
review: Waterfall is worth going if done a hike from Tapovan.

title: Lovely clear n pristine waterfall
review: A good climb of 250 stairs uphill ;got a lil too tiring but well worth the effort

title: Nice Trek
review: Had come here with a guide from our resort Aranyam during our holiday in Rishikesh and loved the trek. Nice place for picnic

title: Great site
review: I wish it was more accessible, if so it would be a real gem.

title: Weekend gateway
review: A good place if you wanna get out of the city on the weekend. The waterfall is a not really a big waterfall but taking a dip makes it worthwhile. There are two waterfalls on the way and water flow depends on the season. You can reach the halfway by car but the road is a lil rocky. The final second waterfall which is at the top is around 2 km trek. Trek is really simple and any gender and age can do it. Don't forget the extra boxers ;)

title: Too crowded and not that clean anymore
review: Visited the place on a week day so you expect less people but we were wrong. 50rs entrance fee plus a hard way up (rent a bike or taxi). A lot of locals leaving garbage around and even throwing plastic bottles in the water. Was nice to have a short swim on a hot day though.

title: not so great
review: this is not a big water fall and not clean. much crowed. we waste our time to visit here. if you have spare time you can visit but nothing special here

title: Superb place to visit
review: Very nice place to visit in Rishikesh. There are two waterfalls one at 1 km stretch and the other one 500m up

title: Refreshing Swim & Hike!
review: Not sure why there are so many poor reviews about Neer Garh being polluted, dirty, busy etc. We had the opposite experience! Clean, amazing swimming, only some other Russian and Indian tourists, lots of space to sit, relax, swim, get a chai. Even a small room to change into your swimsuit in. I would recommend going in the morning for less people. We walked from Tapaovan, paid the 50rs. at the bottom of the road, and walked up. Only reason for 4/5 and not 5/5 was that is wasn't a 'trek' more like walking on the road and there happened to be trees on either side..still clean and beautiful oasis on arrival!

title: Great place to visit
review: This place is a must visit place.

title: #Peace
review: I feel I am a water baby. The water bodies heal some unseen wound in my soul. This place was no exception. I loved the early morning walk to the fall. It is a soothing place witch tapri of chai. It was one of the calming place to drown in your own thoughts.

title: Awesome place
review: We visited this place as a group of friends. We dint expect much from this place but were really surprised when we saw this. It’s a really good place . It’s quite unexplored and is really worth it. Vehicles can go short of this place and then it’s a very small trek .

title: Awesome place dont miss it
review: Wonderful place to visit if you are going to rishikesh.. Lovely scenic beauty.. Clear and cold water...the path to reach the fall is also very beautiful..

title: A tough but worthwhile walk
review: The waterfalls are about an hours walk out of Rishikesh. I walked, but the part along the road isn't very pleasant as you're next to buses and vans honking constantly.

title: Refreshing
review: Pretty clean & accessible by car - remember to take the ticket from counter on main road before driving up.

title: Natural water fall
review: Easily accessible water fall and its near to road but very natural and beautiful. Pressure of water is very high

title: Refreshing cold water in June
review: It was really a good stop to beat the heat. Go there if you are in a group, couples be ready to face the goons there. Giving it five stars because it wasnt really the fault in the place but filthy minds of those men. Note: prefer climbing and going up as it is really crowded at the bottom and the water may no longer feel that fresh and pristine.

title: Scooter and a short hike
review: We rode a scooter to the entrance, purchased a ticket for 50 rupees each and rode up the windy gravel road to the start of the waterfall trek.

title: Wonderful
review: this is a wonderful place.  it is not very crowded and you find cool cool waterfall.  we really enjoyed here.. must go.

title: Water fall with multiple levels
review: This water fall is somewhat on off beat road uphill near Rishikesh. They charge you some entry fee. You will find many people selling food, water etc. For alcohol lovers .... it is banned over here so just don't try your luck as police also have their presence at this place. Found this place good for picnic as you can have table on stream side where you can enjoy the view of fall while having food. For those who are more adventurous, there is a path going higher up the mountain on the way of stream.  Prepare to walk up hill and climb many steps to reach at this beautiful water fall

title: Had a great bathing experience at this small but hidden waterfall.
review: Waterfall's stream was that huge may be because my visit was in summers don"t know about rainy season but really it was refreshing but road to this place is not in good shape but approachable even in a small car.

title: Tranquil spot
review: I visited this waterfall with a group of friends in May. We left early in the morning to beat the sun coming up over the mountain, which was a good decision. The walk up is easy but there are a lot of steps. In some places there is lose gravel so you need to be careful coming back down. You can swim in the natural pool under the waterfall at the top, but be aware the water is very cold. Women need to be modestly dressed but men are ok in just their underwear. There is a small change room near by, so you can get out of your wet gear when finished.

title: For  nature lovers this is a must do - beautiful view - moderate to rigorous hike
review: This hike is totally worth doing for the view and the waterfall and for a  bit of a taste of local culture. You can stop at the chai walla on the way up!

title: Worth Visit Specially For Nature Lovers
review: Far away from the hustle bustle of city.. Really a good place to enjoy the afternoon in such peaceful & scenic atmosphere. It was a random visit so we didn't take the swimsuits with us and later on we are regretting on this. One can enjoy the tea at the main entrance and maggi on top of the hills. Easily accessible by road, A must visit place.

title: Wonderful place to visit
review: I would absolutely recommend to visit this waterfall if you are in Rishikesh.

title: Refreshing and clear
review: It's wonderful place to see, to swim, to have a walk. Easy to reach by foot following the road from Rishikesh. Pass costs about 100 rupies.

title: Went here with 25 kids
review: It is a steep hike up and takes about 30 minutes after you drive up as far as you can. Make sure you have good shoes on (sneakers/tevas).  In March, it is worth jumping into the waterfall and swimming around. But please women wear clothes that cover you, as is the custom.  Be respectful of local norms.

title: Very calm and beautiful place
review: The fall occurs in multiple stages as you keep trekking up the mountain. The first fall starting from around 1km trek, to the final one as far as 3km trek. The place is very beautiful and a must visit. If possible, do take a cab to the place. There is a gravel road all the way up. You can skip the trek and directly enjoy the fall.

title: Wonderful, shame about rubbish
review: A lovely walk from rishikesh and then the walk up each level of the falls offered beautiful views across the landscape.

title: Incredible
review: The waterfall is beautiful.

title: Steep hike to 1 of the best waterfalls.
review: 1. Take a 2 wheeler or 4 wheeler to the 1st small waterfall, after that 30 minutes of hike.

title: Good to visit but no surprise
review: This is a paid waterfall, there are total 3 on the way you walk up. Good to visit but no surprise at all.

title: Nature Scenes
review: Hidden Place in Rishikesh is about 15Kms from the Tapovan where we stayed us. You need to buy Rs 30 entry ticket and it’s a hike of about 2Kms to the waterfall. We went by car till 1st level of waterfall as roads were bad. Less  crowd and you can feel privacy too. At every point, there are benches and maggie’s and chai point.

title: Hidden gem of Rishikesh
review: 3 days back i was there and had good 2 hours at the waterfall. This is a hidden gem of Rishikesh. 12 kms from Laxman Jhulla.

title: No reason to miss
review: It is one of the most beautiful attractions in Rishikesh. Must visit this place. If you like walking, the way from Tapovan to Neergarh is beauty. Some people are doing a great job for keeping the place clean. I request you to carry your wastage with you as people are voluntarily doing efforts to keep it clean. I salute them.

title: Beautiful trek
review: An amazing place for trekking and sightseeing. The waterfall is mesmerising here and do try the chai at one of the stalls.

title: Good trek!
review: Perfect place for trekking and awesome to take a dip under waterfall. The water is very clear and I feel this is the best place to fill your bottles to carry "Gangajal" home!

title: Peaceful and easy to reach.
review: Neer garh falls are worth a visit while visiting Rhishikesh. Only cars can take you close to the falls. A steep climb of almost 70 steps takes you to level 1 of the fall with artificial pond. As you climb higher the falls appear bigger and scenic.

title: Good
review: Found the board for place while I was returning from Neelkanth temple, visited the place the next day morning. Walked from Laxman Jhulla till the top of the water fall. Its was an easy treak, for most of it road has been constructed.

title: We took a Royal Enfield up to the Neer Garth waterfall.
review: We have a Royal Enfield at home and so of course we had to get one for the day and explore. So glad we did as it gave us a great view of the area. A great find was this waterfall. The whole area was very pleasant and not too much traffic to get there.

title: A must do!
review: Nature lovers would do will to not miss an opportunity to visit the Neer Garh waterfalls in Rishikesh. We rode our bikes upto the first level but were too lazy to climb all the way to the third. Nonetheless an amazing place. Make sure not to leave your waste behind!

title: Great Water fall
review: Its a must see place. Its scenic adventurous and fun. It has 3 levels and the views get better as you go up further.

title: Beautiful waterfall
review: amazing waterfall for adventure and also for splashing in crystal clear cool water. super exciting and very scenic.

title: SUPER TREK
review: What an awesome short hike. Thank you Govind ji from Aranyam resort for getting me here. Would love to visit again.

title: Small yet beautiful waterfall
review: Small yet beautiful waterfall, it took 1 km of walk. trek to reach the waterfall but it was worth it and loved every bit of it. you can stand below waterfall and it makeing it worth everything. must visit place during the day time.

title: Nice cold and massaging waterfall
review: This is one of the good waterfall I have seen. refreshing and cold. water fall when you go under it is soothing and give massaging effect. Must see if visiting Rishikesh. The treck is also good. Kids will enjoy the falls. the pool is small and less crowded. safe for kids. The maggi you get down the fall is a good concept. chairs on the flowing water. Overall good experience.

title: Extremely nice place ..will touch your heart and soul
review: We just reached there . Make sure you book a cab . taxi for to & fro journey . Approach road is still under construction . Not many people knows about this so almost no crowd and shops except some small "maggi" sellers  . nice to swim , mediate and spend mini 2-3 hrs .  No pollution , no disturbance , no sound except of Water fall & some birds ..Amazing place ..

title: Nature and going with flow!
review: Great morning out. I suggest starting out early and simply enjoying a morning waking up with nature and absorbing the positive energy from the flowing water. Its  a stunning waterfall, go with no expectations and be delighted by what nature has created.

title: Good place to refresh.
review: Nice waterfall, because possible to swim, relax, do nature massage. It takes about ore than one hour fro Rishikesh. I think it's possible to take tuk - tuk and you not need to walk so long. And you should know where is it. In day tie could be very hot.

title: Visitor
review: Very nice walk from Lacshman Julie to the waterfall less then two hours.

title: Must visit!
review: If you visit Rishikesh you have to rent a bike and go there

title: Get out of town
review: This waterfall is stunning, I was so surprised that this little gem was so close to town however so away from the bustle of things. I was tipped by locals to make the short trip and I am so glad that I did :)

title: Again a small waterfall..
review: Again it's a very small waterfall. If you have visited waterfalls like tirathgarh or Chitrakut don't go here. We need to take tickets from hill down and go either by cab or bikes. There is a small fall which you will see first, after trekking some more height you can see a bigger one. It's 2 kms from rishikesh, better come in bike in a sunny leisure day.

title: Lovely waterfall and pool
review: A long dusty journey to get here, but worth it for the enjoyment of having a dip in the clear natural waterfall pool, and then having a chai sitting in the "water cafe"!

title: Good trek for family..
review: You can go upto certain point with your vehicle by paying nominal fee, from there you are on your own. The water fall has three pit stops. Try to reach the peak point, worth the trek (during monsoon)!

title: Three levels of waterfalls
review: One of the few non-spiritual activities to do in Rishikesh. Thoroughly enjoyed the walk up the waterfall.

title: Good
review: For detailed review of neer garh falls and other places in rishikesh visit my blog Hopping Heels. Link of blog is given in my profile

title: Amazing
review: I would say this is natural swimming pool. There are three waterfalls. We went to the third one, the highest one. Water is clear. And I stood under the exact waterfall. It was so much fun.

title: “Fabulous place!.....Amazing waterfalls...
review: A must visit in Rishikesh. Waterfalls are beautiful and view is amazing surrounded by greenery and mountains. Nature at its best.

title: Must check in there
review: Amazing water fall .. These are the dont miss place in rishikesh. Must go and enjoy beauty of nature over there.

title: A Nice place to visit and fun
review: It is a very good place for fun, suited all proposes like romantic, family or friends group. You will also enjoy small jungle trek till the water fall. A Nice place to visit and fun.

title: Don't go to 1st waterfall
review: Approaching road is very bumpy & risky, No proper parking, No bathrooms, Changing Rooms were dirty with broken doors, people pissed in it. No proper steps to reach fall. Small pool made for people have big, pointed stones which will hurt you as you walk in it. No secured place to keep your belongings.

title: nature in abundance
review: The fall was just 2 kms away from my hotel.Once you reach there you have to trek for approximately one km, but its very steep. there is a short cut also but that is very dangerous . one you reach you will see a small fall with a safe pool.

title: Natural pool
review: Excellent water fall with a natural pool , where you can take bath in the most clearest water. It was a short 2 km treck where you get the best time. There are three areas where you get the natural pool. But the first one has the most amount of water where u get refreshed

title: awesome hike and waterfall
review: This is an awesome short hike which takes you to the waterfall and a natural pool. Start early to avoid the crowd. You really do not need a vehicle to go there. You can take a bus from the highway and stop at the entry gate. Hike usually take 1 hour and you will really enjoy the pool.

title: Lost in Nature
review: little hard to trek all the way up. but if you want to see nature beauty u should go all the way up on the fourth waterfall which is not so crowded and one can spend time alone in nature.recomended time is early morning from 6-10 am

title: So So
review: Not very interesting. U would have been to much better waterfall earlier. If not then u can visit this place. u have to go first up by car, then u track to 1st waterfall. which is 5 min walk. water is not very clean. then u walk to real water fall , which is 30 min walk. again u will find same type of waterfall only difference is , it is lot cleaner.

title: Approached from uphill side after a long trek down from Kanjpuri
review: Very refreshing on a hot sunny day and very welcome when you have been walking for several hours in the sun.

title: Good Waterfall in Rishikesh
review: We went by Car till the base of Waterfall. Road is scary, very narrow, construction work is going on. Entry fees is 30 rs per person. We went till first waterfall only which is 5 minutes climb. If you go there then you can swim there too, we had paucity of time so didn't drench. Maggi available at shops outside.

title: Beautiful place to break out from busy life
review: Only a few kilometers ride from Rishikesh main town, this beautiful waterfall will offer you break from everyday busy life. A natural place that makes you feel so close to mother earth and sooths your brain. This summer alone I went to NeerGarh waterfall thrice with yoga training participants at our (Vishwa Shanti Yoga) school. They all enjoyed the beauty and calmness of this place to greater extent. Having them try different yoga poses was interesting part of our trip.

title: Must visit place
review: Plan this visit while going to Neelkanth temple, may be on return from temple. Have Maggie at Neer Jharna

title: Trek and swim
review: It is few kilometers distance from city . one need to Trek half a kilometre to reach it .A swim after Trek would rise your senses and make your journey more memorable .Stay some time at the place to feel it.

title: Maggi Point
review: Amazing place. You need to hire a bike or scooter to reach this place, not very far from the main road.

title: Small but very nice waterfall
review: This place is hardly few kms from Tapovan. The access roads is being constructed now, so only SUVs can go here. It's a very small trek to the fall. But once in the fall, it is amazing! Small enough not be risky, but force enough for everyone to enjoy!

title: Beautiful waterfall
review: A small but beautifull waterfall. I suggest to hire a scooty or bike from Laxman Jhula to go there. One need to purchase of ticket of Rs 30 to go up there at waterfall. They have made a small pond at the bottom of waterfall for bathing purpose.

title: Amazing view of Waterfall
review: Amazing view of nature from Neer Garh Waterfall.

title: Tiring trek, beautiful result ;)
review: There is almost 1.5KM trek from bottom to top. The trek is a bit tiring as its quite steep at few places and the steps add on as well.

title: A Good Hike
review: Started early morning as May is a bit warm to do this hike.  We didn't make it to the top waterfall but nonetheless a good workout

title: Must go
review: If u going to  Rishikesh must go to to neer garh waterfalls... U I'll really like it with friends or family

title: Must visit preferably on a bike
review: It is one of those places where the journey is as rewarding as the view. I took a bike on rent to reach there. The road is very steep and filled with rocks. Ride slowly and you will enjoy every second of it. Take about 25-30 minutes to reach the top. Avoid taking a car as it will get very difficult to maneuver at some places. Must visit place in Rishikesh.

title: Quite adventurous
review: One of my friend from haridwar recommended this place as its quite adventurous place for reaching waterfall you have to go through a very rough road as its very small,but it does worth it

title: Gud place to have quick relief from summer
review: Spent afternoon at waterfall after playing Holi in Rishikesh. There are number of small points to enjoy waterfall while trekking till top of waterfall. Maggi at waterfall was additional fun. Whole of body was relieved after trekking around 1.5-2 km uphill to waterfall.

title: Sad state of Affairs
review: After much hype we reached this small waterfall but it was waste effort to reach there as there is nothing great about this place.

title: Water Beautiful
review: The water was flowing at certain places in this waterfall but the walk in it was amazing with beautiful jungle experience

title: Where there is water I love the place
review: Lovely peaceful place after a beautiful track through the hill...

title: A water fall with pool
review: located about 3.5 kilometers from tapovan, rishikesh. now you can drive up to base of the water fall and need to climb only abou 50 meters of steps to reach first step of the fall.

title: I enjoy so much in water fall
review: Mother nature make this water fall so much beautiful and calmfull area and adventures and maggi and cold drink stall makes more amazing ...

title: Road are horrible
review: Too many people in one place... poor road.

title: divine.
review: it was good enperience. we  trekked from tapovan to waterfall and till the top of waterfall. though the crowd was no so good but the place is awesome. must visit but leave the place before 5pm. and also, if you don't have a habit to walk alot. hire a vehicle from tapovan and then come.

title: 2nd best thing to do after the rafting
review: Went with my friends,could expect that this place will going to be so much good,with a waterfall nd a pool around,enjoyed a lot.must recommend for travellers.go n have fun.

title: Exhausting yet Exhillerating
review: I went to Neer Garh Waterfalls in April end in scorching temps. Trekking to the top where the actual waterfall is a task to accomplish in itself - first you need to travel around 1.5km from the ticket counter to the point where the trek actually starts (there is no option to reach to that point if you don't have your own vehicle). Once you reach the start point, you need to reach to the top through mountainous staircases which are in deteriorating conditions. The gaurds at the bottom say its a 1 km trek but in actuality its close to 3kms, its a steep trek to the top.

title: Wish it was hotter so could swim.
review: Make sure you walk to the very top where the main fall and pool are. You can even walk further if you want more views or check out local villages.

title: Scenic trek
review: The trek upto the waterfall might seem like a lot to city dwellers. But it is worth the climb.

title: Peaceful and soulful
review: It a small hike to reach the head of the waterfall but it is completely worth it. Reach there to loosen up and meditate with nature.

title: Hidden beauty among the hills
review: Trekking this waterfall was absolute fun! The water is pure and the place is not very crowded, so it is totally worth visiting :)

title: nice waterfall very close to rishikesh
review: the falls are hardly 10 min drive from Lakshman Jhula. the road leading upto the falls was in pretty bad shape making driving almost impossible. we had to stop midway and walk the rest of the distance. once there, all the efforts proved to be worth. the falls are beautiful and being in midst of the hills make it all the more scenic.

title: wonderful waterfall
review: 10 minutes from the Lakshman Jhula- i did it with Hitchhike.

title: A good refreshing experience
review: The palce is quite nice but flooded with people and vendors. though the waterfall was refreshing and replenishing. You will enjoy it with your friends and family

title: Beautiful Waterfall!
review: I am not a hiker, and usually do not spend much time walking up or down hills or mountains of any kind; however, the sunrise at the top of the mountain and the 3 hour hike down to this waterfall are well worth it!  It is a lovely and peaceful (albeit steep and rocky) hike, filled with beautiful trees, birds (would be great for bird watchers, as there are many species specific to this area), and lovely little towns buried in the hill.  What a lovely feeling to be hearing the powerful sounds of a waterfall as approaching it.  Then, when the hill opens to it, it is quite beautiful.  It isn't a massive waterfall, but is quite spectacular in it's own right.

title: Ultimate destination
review: Too much fun.. With foreigners friends.. had good time  with them. . Lot of fun.. With London friends

title: Nice place a bit small but good
review: I have seen better waterfalls but those are in North East, As per north standard this one is good. Small but beautiful.

title: "Beautiful Waterfall"
review: This Waterfall is really beautiful. If u want to have some peace and relaxation visit there and take a bath in the waterfall. But Please Do not pollute it.

title: A good little walk from Laxman Jhula
review: The waterfall is nothing special in itself, but it's the perfect distance from Laxman Jhula if you want to go for a little walk. The get there, we followed the river and then climbed up (getting lost once or twice). Coming back, we opted for the road, which was easier but also much less enjoyable.

title: Nice Falls
review: Good hike form the town with nice views on the way. Small entrance fee- bring id with you- they want to see your passport(?) -not something I take with me for a nature walk. On the day we were there it was nice and quiet, not many visitors. Some road construction, reinforcement works going on on the trail-not interfering with the enjoyment. Falls are nice, cold water. It feels good to put in your feet in and sit for a few minutes.

title: Nice hike and falls
review: Nice swimming hole and waterfalls... The hike up is lovely and quite popular, plenty of smaller spots to jump in the water also

title: Captivating beauty
review: A must visit spot in Rishikesh. It is best to visit either early in the morning or late evening to experience waterfall of your own kind of feeling.

title: Beautiful waterfall
review: Along a moderately steep walk, this waterfall has many different cascading falls and ponds, in beautiful natural settings

title: A good hike and a lovely waterfall
review: I was happy that I visited this waterfall, a good hike and a climb, the location and the fall is very good. I would not miss this, and had a great time bathing in the cold waters.

title: Not to be missed... Your own private waterfall...
review: This hidden gem in Rishikesh is about 3 kms from the Swiss Cottage area where we stayed. Its a hike of about 30 mins to the top but being lazy I took my car up to the first level of the waterfall. At 7 in the morning when no one's there, it's like your own private waterfall. Cold water streaming down. Taking a bath in the cold water in the month of December in Rishikesh, never though would be such an awesome experience.

title: Great hike.
review: Started from Kanjipura temple pre dawn and hiked down past villages, paddy fields to the waterfall.  Around 8 miles. A must do in Rishikesh area. Well worth it.

title: Awesome waterfall
review: Try the trek from Kunjapuri to this waterfall to enjoy this water from top to bottom it just takes 4 to 5 hours from 6am to 11am check with siva sakthi guest house for the trek schedule

title: Amazing waterfall
review: We visited this waterfall on monsoon after it had rained overnight and the power of the water was amazing. It is a bit hairy to reach however; we took the taxi up but I wouldn't recommend this, you need a SUV or maybe hike up, the road is very narrow and dangerous.

title: NeerGarh Waterfall - Hidden Jewels of Rishikesh !!!
review: Neergarh waterfalls are a group of Waterfalls which are formed by the same stream falling at different places. These are at an accesible distance of 5 kms from Laxman jhula. You can take a Taxi or visit Cafe Karma and request for a Waterfall trip. They provide Packed Lunches which is delicious.

title: Mesmerising all the way
review: Well, this place proves the saying that Sweet are the fruits of adversity. Or Mehnat ka faal meetha hota hai.. A trek of about 30-35 mins. But once you reach the top, i bet you would forget all the tiredness. Free flowing water and cool as ice. Felt very relaxed and rejuvenated.

title: Nature is truly beautiful
review: The waterfall is a lot of fun. If you go early in the morning the. You can enjoy even more. As there is no one there and you have the whole waterfall to yourself. Fun!

title: Nice
review: we visited this waterfall on monsoon after it had rained overnight and the power of the water was amazing. Water is very cool a good enjoyed our all friends There natural is very good  I want again visit Neer  waterfall

title: Refreshing Experience avoid if with kids
review: The road to the first waterfall is motarable but is bit risky if you do not have vehicle in very good condition, have dedicated time for visiting the waterfall and try to reach there by walk, many people do so, the climb to the waterfall is steep and hence difficult to reach if you are with child...

title: Definetly DO
review: Definetly go there when you're in the area. It's the first waterfall of the 2 waterfalls in the mountains and you can get there also with a jeep so a mountain trek can be avoided.Tourist ticket of 15 rupees/per person is asked on entry. Try to go on a not so busy time to get the waterfall for yourself, the water is warmer than in the Ganges! Women should cover themselves or wear the spiritual traveller camouflage since otherwise the locals could show their disapproval.

title: Amazing
review: The entrance fee is 30 rupees, then you need to go up by mountain road and after 25-30 min - up by stairs. But on the top you will find beatufil waterfall, you can have a bath there :)

title: Potential to be beautiful but too much Garbage.
review: It's a great day trip and the falls are very refreshing to swim in. My only concern was the amount of garbage up there. We paid 30 INR per person to enter. They should use the tourist fees to clean the area up and it would be much more enjoyable .

title: Good, but go in early morning to avoid crowd
review: The weather was awesome and we decided to trek to the waterfalls from the highway( the place from where you buy the entry tickets).Also, we had no idea that we could take our car almost till the waterfalls.Most of the people(80%) drive to the top as the road is motorable.The falls were too overcrwoded when we visited, it being an extended weekend.So, we chose to move a lil' downwards where a smaller fall was being created and enjoyed our time there.All in all , a refreshing experience.Enjoy the waterfalls, nothing great about the trekking experience!

title: My favourite place in Rishikesh but use the entrance fee to atleast clean up the rubbish.
review: This waterfall is a whole lot of waterfalls and if you want some peace and quiet there is a great pool halfway up.

title: its not worthwhile going here
review: there is nothing much here except travelling on broken roads. there is entry ticket and u feel dissapointed to see litlle stream of water coming down. its name is simply bemuses me NEERGARH WATERFALLS as if there is a big and might waterfall but in actual its a small stream of water flowing down.

title: Wonderfall
review: Many things contributed to make it wonderful as we decided to walk/trek to Neergarh waterfall from Narayan Palace resort a distance of about a kilometer plus trek uphill about less than a kilometer. First the weather was excellent to trek and we discovered a short cut to trek to this wonderful waterfall as it had also started drizzling. We had gone prepared to bath in the fall and it was some experience as we were the only people there which made it look like our personal waterfall. Though you have to be careful to find a suitable rock for standing under the fall and you may also come across few crabs in between rocks there. On our return we incidentally found a sort of a pond with small fall which made it look like a private jaccuzi and we had lot of fun there. It turned out to be a memorable visit.

title: Fun of your in town anyway
review: It is a little hard to get to, but it is a fun morning or afternoon trip.  Not worth a trip to Rishikesh, but if your here go enjoy it.

title: Fun with Tracking
review: This is a really good place for people who are beginners with tracking. From main road its 2.5 KM tracking though light vehicle can also reach to first fall. 2nd fall is another 0.5 M high and can be reached via tracking only. At end fall it was a decent size pool with really clean, cool and refreshing water. You will forget your tired ness once you are in pool.

title: Wonderful
review: Neer falls are about 7 kms from main city of Rishikesh, off route not a regular road, if going in rains please check if it is open, else car and bikes go there, take some steps and you will be at a natural swimming pool and fall, very good in summers for taking bath. If you like trekking you can go more up to see bigger fall, Trekking is about 1.5 kms

title: An amazing view
review: You need to pay a tourist admission fee!!. A hefty walk up but glad I made it half way to a smaller water fall. There was a little pool were me and friends paddled and then proceeded to sit near the edge just to take in the fantastic views. A group who were already there told if we continued up we would come to another waterfall (the same waterfall but just a bit higher). So continued to drag myself up to and I was not disappointed.

title: Half an hour trek and great memories
review: It few Km ahead of the city . You have to pay a nominal entry fee to get started  for the trek you can take your two wheeler to the fall but a bit risk as the road ahead is just a trek route . the govt has made a small pond and a bridge near the pool to cross and go ahead to the top but mostly people get tired by the time they get to the natural pond.You won't get much to eat here so carry your own eatables but don't leave the litter behind. Water fall is beautiful and calming.

title: Nice place to visit
review: I would definitely suggest this place if you are having multiple days in Rishikesh. There are two waterfall one by one. Its 5 kms far from Lakshman Jhula and there is small road going to waterfall. Bikes and small van type of cars can easily travel apart from monsoon. Once you are at the base (there is water on the road which is identity of the place) you will see small waterfall with small artificial swimming pool. If you want more you can trek 1.5 kms more to bigger one.

title: very nice place to trecking.
review: Great enjoyfull experience of this water fall.Sight is situated at hill top.everywhere greenary all around here.dense forest place.

title: Amazing,beautiful waterfalls with some trekking..
review: Although Rishikesh is full of natural beauty, but this place has taken my heart away. Simply awesome. Just few kms from Laxman jhoola, Rishikesh is this waterfall.

title: LOVED IT!
review: What a hike! You can pay a little to hike up the road or take the path up but it's enduring to walk and see this beautiful waterfall, falls I should say. Walk about 20 minutes up the road (maybe longer or shorter depending on your speed). At the bottom of the first fall is a food stand that has refreshing drinks, and food to serve. Walk another 15-20 minutes and you'll come to a bigger water hole with a bridge walking over. Beware of the ALL the Indians bathing in their underwear.

title: Thats what you call an infinity pool!!!
review: A short trek of 20-25 minutes and you reach the best infinity pool you can imagine - right under a waterfall. There is a small family which runs a shack here - amazing maggi and tea.

title: only if you love waterfalls...
review: If you like to go for a long hike and end up next to a small waterfalls, it worth it. If not... i wouldn't waste my time there.

title: Good to visit
review: Good to visit if you have time in hand, since you can reach to smaller fall by car now, an adventurous 2Km or so drive on kaccha road from main highway. Roam around and chill with some maggi and chai!

title: Exciting trek
review: Awesome trek and a waterfall. Maggi that local people make there is simply awesome and is a must have.

title: Rejuvenating is d word...
review: A bit of trekking and there you are. The main area of the waterfall can be somewhat crowded and also, u cannot go under the falls as it is quite deep. So we went back on a lower level and chose a secluded spot. We laid there in the falls for almost two hours. The water is very clear. Just grab a rock, dip your feet and have tea and Maggi while in the falls..

title: Amazing Oasis
review: hiked from the mountaintop--the temple at Kunjipuri--down 6 km to the waterfall.  I didn't worry about trekking the remaining 2 km wet, I just jumped in and swam.  But next time I will bring a suit, change in the hut, and do it right ;)  Worth it!!

title: Trek to NeerGarh
review: NeerGarh falls is around 6-8 KM from Ram Jhula. We decided to trek to this place and started early in the morning. One can get to see beautiful valleys along the way. The waterfall has multiple view points at different heights.

title: Worth a visit
review: We walked to the waterfall from Tapavan, so walked along the road before getting to the hill which was really nice with the views of the ganges along the way.

title: Nice hike to the waterfall
review: Parked our car and walked up to visit this lovely little waterfall on the hill.

title: Meh waterfall
review: I walked up to this waterfall near sunset. I enjoyed the walk along the winding road and the views of the Ganga below; for these two reasons I recommend it, particularly if you need exercise and walk up.The waterfall it's self is not particularly exciting. This may be because I come from a land of hundred foot plus waterfalls...this is 20 to 30 feet and did not get my heart racing, like giant waterfalls do.

title: Short hike from Rishikesh to a beautiful waterfall
review: Neer Garh is a smallish waterfall a few hours from Rishikesh. It took us 2 hours to walk from Lakshman Jhula to reach the base of the waterfall. We walked along the winding road, which sometimes seemed a little dangerous when many cars were driving by. If you do not want to walk, there are a few buses and taxis that will take you to the base point. The climb from the base is more tedious and can take up to an hour. There are 3 main points of the waterfall till the top. The waterfall is pretty secluded, with only a few tourists around. In the summer months, having a bath there and picnic later would be fun. There is a small food stall, which sells hot maggi noodles and tea. I would recommend Neer Garh to people who would want to go for a nearby easy trek. Early morning is the best time to visit.

title: superb sight n dangerusly beautiful fall. must visit sight
review: should not allow pple to eat their itself .those small eatery stalls should be located n the ground floor in the approach road.

title: A short hike and a small series of waterfalls
review: You can take a cab till the base of the waterfall too, and then walk up the last kilometre or son. I walked 2 km from Tapovan, Rishikesh till I saw the board to the forest office. 15 Rupees for the permit. I walked the remaining 2 kilometres too. Took a short cut after a kilometre following the advice of a tea stall owner. The short cut takes you to one of the lower falls. No people around. I saw four small waterfalls overall down the stream, with the biggest one being the one on top. Each of these have a small pool in front of them where you can take bath. Not deep.

title: nice place to visit
review: if you love water then do visit here once. great musty with family, suggest you to visit in summer as it's very cold these day.

title: Incredible and restorative place
review: Two incredible falls, with possibility of feeding on the spot. A quiet climb but need for resistance, clean and crystal clear water.

title: must visit
review: what a hidden gem in rishikesh. 30 rs per person charge and a bit of a climb to get to this paradise.

title: Trek to a hidden gem above Neer Waterfall
review: Being popularized as AQUAONEWORLD and Neer SHIVA CAFE, it's a must visit for anyone be it a traveller or someone looking to come back to nature and oneself.

title: Must place to visit..Hidden trekking
review: Firstly when we heard about this we were it will b a water fall ,we just have to reach there and see.But surprisingly we need to trek for almost 2 hrs to see the actual water fall.While on the trek there are many stalls from which u can have water,tea,coffee,cold drinks,maggi,egg etc.

title: Neer Garh Waterfall
review: My trip was very nice. I enjoyed a lot. The scenic beauty was very beautiful. Adorable scenery. One should definately visit this place.

title: Lovely waterfall with beautiful birds!
review: Visited Feb 7, 2019. Lovely falls, nice ride to view countryside.  Amit was a great driver (recommended from hotel yog vashishth).  Ate breakfast at a local place "Waterfall Restaurant".  best omelette believe it or not!  delicious food (nope, didn't get sick!).  looked scary, but the people were so nice and breakfast was fresh eggs and toast and excellent milk tea.  recommend falls and breakfast !!

title: good walk
review: Worth taking a good walk if you are the walking type. The rewarding view when you reach the falls is calming.

title: Superb waterfall trek with wonderful views
review: We stayed at Aloha resorts and booked this nature walk through them only. Anuj , our guide helped us with his continuous support and knowledge about the area. He provided us sticks and his co-guide Vishal helped us climb the difficult terrain.They carried foldable chairs and refreshments for us. On reaching there they both made us comfortable in chairs with our feet in water near the waterfall. We enjoyed snacks and hot tea with beautiful view of waterfall and birds chirping around. We spent an hour there and returned.

title: Good but not that great
review: This spot is not very far from Laxman jhoola . You need to pay Rs 30 per head for entry for Indians and Rs 50 for foreigners . Waterfall is a short trek away from the parking spot . In simmering summers ,it's a good option to spend time in cold water without having to worry about the current as its a good pool where people can enjoy .

title: Incredible and restorative place
review: Two incredible falls, with possibility of feeding on the spot. A quiet climb but need for resistance, clean and crystal clear water.

title: nice place to visit
review: if you love water then do visit here once. great musty with family, suggest you to visit in summer as it's very cold these day.

title: Trek to a hidden gem above Neer Waterfall
review: Being popularized as AQUAONEWORLD and Neer SHIVA CAFE, it's a must visit for anyone be it a traveller or someone looking to come back to nature and oneself.

title: Must place to visit..Hidden trekking
review: Firstly when we heard about this we were it will b a water fall ,we just have to reach there and see.But surprisingly we need to trek for almost 2 hrs to see the actual water fall.While on the trek there are many stalls from which u can have water,tea,coffee,cold drinks,maggi,egg etc.

title: must visit
review: what a hidden gem in rishikesh. 30 rs per person charge and a bit of a climb to get to this paradise.

title: Lovely waterfall with beautiful birds!
review: Visited Feb 7, 2019. Lovely falls, nice ride to view countryside.  Amit was a great driver (recommended from hotel yog vashishth).  Ate breakfast at a local place "Waterfall Restaurant".  best omelette believe it or not!  delicious food (nope, didn't get sick!).  looked scary, but the people were so nice and breakfast was fresh eggs and toast and excellent milk tea.  recommend falls and breakfast !!

title: Neer Garh Waterfall
review: My trip was very nice. I enjoyed a lot. The scenic beauty was very beautiful. Adorable scenery. One should definately visit this place.

title: good walk
review: Worth taking a good walk if you are the walking type. The rewarding view when you reach the falls is calming.

title: Superb waterfall trek with wonderful views
review: We stayed at Aloha resorts and booked this nature walk through them only. Anuj , our guide helped us with his continuous support and knowledge about the area. He provided us sticks and his co-guide Vishal helped us climb the difficult terrain.They carried foldable chairs and refreshments for us. On reaching there they both made us comfortable in chairs with our feet in water near the waterfall. We enjoyed snacks and hot tea with beautiful view of waterfall and birds chirping around. We spent an hour there and returned.

title: Good but not that great
review: This spot is not very far from Laxman jhoola . You need to pay Rs 30 per head for entry for Indians and Rs 50 for foreigners . Waterfall is a short trek away from the parking spot . In simmering summers ,it's a good option to spend time in cold water without having to worry about the current as its a good pool where people can enjoy .
